So this is a pretty straightforward report to you.  to reflect a resolution made by the Waikato Civil Defence and Emergency Management Group Joint Committee. So the Waikato Joint Committee revisited the topic of controller appointments and delegations in response to the state of national emergency for the COVID-19 event. It was decided that all local controllers and their alternates  would be elevated to a tier two status in the Waikato group, which means that a local controller can operate in any local authority area as part of their EOC within the Waikato group. Now, such a move was seemed essential to ensure that there was sustainability and adequate coverage as a group  given the health risks inherent in the current COVID-19 climate. Fortunately, none of the Western Waikato local controllers have fallen ill to COVID-19, so there has not been a need to secure additional local controllers for the COVID-19 response. But that situation could easily have changed very quickly.  However, going forward for any emergency response, it is appropriate to have adequate coverage of controllers for all the EOCs operating in the Waikato. The Civil Defence and Emergency Management Group Joint Committee decision and the recommendations in this report will provide the necessary appointments and delegation coverage going forward. So this resolution has been requested to be passed by all the territorial authorities  councils in the Waikato region who is represented by the Joint Committee. And Councillor Lou Brown is our Civil Defence and Emergency Management Joint Committee representative, and he may wish to speak further on this matter. But essentially, the recommendation is noted in paragraphs 2A, B and C for your decision. That's a report, Your Worship.
